title: How to Block a Website in Google Chrome

steps.title: Open the Block Site page.
steps.content: Open the Block Site page . Block Site is a free Chrome plugin that lets you block individual pages or entire websites. While the free version is great for blocking websites, you can also upgrade to a paid membership to password-protect your block list so nobody can make changes.

steps.title: Click Add to Chrome.
steps.content: Click Add to Chrome . It's a blue button in the upper-right side of the page. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click Add extension to confirm.
steps.content: Click Add extension to confirm. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Review the terms and click I Accept.
steps.content: Review the terms and click I Accept . Block Site is now installed. The basic features of the extension, including the ability to block websites, is free. If you are prompted to subscribe, click Skip at the top-right corner.

steps.title: Click the Block Site icon.
steps.content: Click the Block Site icon. It's a shield-shaped icon in the upper-right area of the Chrome. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click the gear icon.
steps.content: Click the gear icon. It's at the top-right corner of the Block Site window. This loads the Block Site page. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Add a website.
steps.content: Add a website. Click the "Enter a web address" text box near the top of the page, then type in the address of the website that you want to block. [4] X Research source For example, if you wanted to block everything on the Twitter.com domain, you could type twitter.com . If you want to block a specific page on a website, go to that page, then copy the address by clicking the address bar at the top of the window and then pressing Ctrl + C (Windows) or Command + C (Mac). Once copied, right-click the field in Block Site and select Paste .

steps.title: Click ＋Add Item.
steps.content: Click ＋Add Item . It's at the right side of the text field. The website will immediately be added to Block Site's list of blocked websites. [5] X Research source You can remove your site from Block Site's blacklist at any time by clicking the red circle icon to the right of the website's URL in the list of blocked sites.

steps.title: Set up Password Protection (optional).
steps.content: Set up Password Protection (optional). If you want to make sure nobody can edit your block list but you, you can pay to upgrade to Blocksite's Unlimited plan, which comes with password and uninstall protection. [6] X Research source If you sign up, click Password Protection in the left panel, and follow the on-screen instructions to create your secure password.

steps.title: Allow Block Site in incognito mode (optional).
steps.content: Allow Block Site in incognito mode (optional). Another way that people can use to get around Block Site's restrictions is by using Chrome's Incognito mode. Here's how to prevent this: Click the menu at the top-right corner of Chrome ⋮ Select More tools Click Extensions Click DETAILS below the "Block Site" heading Click the "Allow in incognito" to enable the feature.

steps.title: Download the Block Site app from the Play Store .
steps.content: Download the Block Site app from the Play Store . This is a free app that lets you block websites in the Android version of Chrome. Once you've opened the Play Store from the app drawer, follow these steps: Tap the search bar. Type in blocksite and tap Go or Enter . Tap the app called BlockSite with a reddish shield containing a warning symbol. [7] X Research source Tap INSTALL below the "BlockSite - Block Distracting Apps and Sites" heading. Tap ACCEPT if prompted.

steps.title: Tap OPEN to launch BlockSite.
steps.content: Tap OPEN to launch BlockSite. If you closed the Play Store, you can open BlockSite by tapping its shield icon in your app drawer.

steps.title: Review the terms and tap I ACCEPT.
steps.content: Review the terms and tap I ACCEPT .

steps.title: Tap ENABLE ACCESSIBILITY.
steps.content: Tap ENABLE ACCESSIBILITY . It's the green button at the bottom of the Welcome screen. This opens your Android's Accessibility settings.

steps.title: Slide the BlockSite switch to On .
steps.content: Slide the BlockSite switch to On . You may have to tap OK to continue. This lets BlockSite block sites on your Android.

steps.title: Tap the X to return to BlockSite.
steps.content: Tap the X to return to BlockSite. It's at the top-left corner of the screen that prompts you to upgrade your membership. BlockSite will reopen.

steps.title: Tap the plus ＋.
steps.content: Tap the plus ＋ . It's a green button in the bottom-right corner of the screen. Doing so will take you to the page where you can block websites. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Enter a website's address.
steps.content: Enter a website's address. Tap the text field at the top of the screen, then type in the address of a website (e.g., facebook.com ) that you want to block. You don't need to type out the entire web address; just typing in the basic _____.com address will work.

steps.title: Tap the ＋ on the matching website.
steps.content: Tap the ＋ on the matching website. This adds the selected website to your block list.

steps.title: Tap the checkmark [[Image:
steps.content: Tap the checkmark [[Image: |techicon|x30px|alt=]]. It's in the top-right corner of the screen. This adds the website to Block Site's list of blocked sites, which prevents you from visiting the site in Chrome, as well as other browsers on your Android. [9] X Research source You can unblock this website at any time by tapping the trash icon to the right of its name.

steps.title: Block an entire app on your Android (optional).
steps.content: Block an entire app on your Android (optional). If you have to temporarily block an app, you can do so by tapping ＋ in the bottom-right corner of the Block Site screen, and choose one of the apps in the "App Suggestions" list to add it to the block list. Like websites, you can unblock the app at any time by tapping the trash icon to the right of its name.

steps.title: Open your iPhone or iPad's Settings .
steps.content: Open your iPhone or iPad's Settings . It's the gear icon on the home screen or in a sub-folder. If you want to block a website in the iPhone/iPad version of Chrome, you'll need to block in your main settings. This will also block the site on Safari and any other browsers you use. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Screen Time.
steps.content: Tap Screen Time . It's the purple hourglass icon in the second group of settings. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Turn On Screen Time.
steps.content: Tap Turn On Screen Time . If Screen Time is not already enabled, tapping this will enable it, allowing you to create a Screen Time password and block websites. If you've already turned on Screen Time, skip to Step 6.

steps.title: Tap Continue and select the phone's owner.
steps.content: Tap Continue and select the phone's owner. If you've already set up Screen Time on this phone, you can skip this step. If the phone is yours, tap This is My iPhone . If the phone belongs to your child, tap This is My Child's iPhone . This will enable Screen Time, which lets you block websites. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Create a Screen Time passcode if you don't already have one.
steps.content: Create a Screen Time passcode if you don't already have one. If you see an option called Use Screen Time Passcode under the "Content & Privacy Restrictions" option, tap it, and then follow the on-screen instructions to create a 4-digit PIN. If you see Change Screen Time Passcode instead, you already have a passcode and there's no need to create one. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Content & Privacy Restrictions.
steps.content: Tap Content & Privacy Restrictions . It's the option with a red icon containing a warning symbol.

steps.title: Tap the "Content & Privacy Restrictions" switch to turn it On .
steps.content: Tap the "Content & Privacy Restrictions" switch to turn it On . If this switch was already on, skip to the next step instead. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Content Restrictions.
steps.content: Tap Content Restrictions . It's in the first group of settings.

steps.title: Tap Web Content.
steps.content: Tap Web Content . It's in the middle of the menu.

steps.title: Select Limit Adult Websites.
steps.content: Select Limit Adult Websites . This is the option that lets you block specific websites. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Add Website under "Never Allow."
steps.content: Tap Add Website under "Never Allow." It's the second instance of "Add Website" on the page.

steps.title: Enter the URL you want to block.
steps.content: Enter the URL you want to block. For example, if you want to block Facebook, you'd enter www.facebook.com . Tap done when you're finished to add the site to your blocked list and return you to the previous page. If you'd like to remove a site from the blocked list, swipe left on the site under the "Never Allow" header and select Delete .
